page.title: 03OCCUPATIONS AROUND FATHOM
page.content: Although this is mainly a rural area, the majority of the people don't make a living from the land because of its infertile, hilly nature. However, there are 3 dairy farms, 2 chicken farms and one pig farm which are all primarily family concerns absorbing no local labour. The population consists mainly of young professional married couples who find employment in the adjoining towns of Newry and Warrenpoint. Generally speaking, due to the fact that these are young couples with families of school age, there is little youth unemployment or indeed unemployment as a whole. This however is not indicative of the general situation throughout the rest of the country. Apart from the self-employed and the professionals there are some retired people living in the district.
